sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Analysts warn that a record year-end options expiry is now the dominant volatility driver, as bitcoin traded under $90000 while gold surged.
Dogecoin analysis explained through market regimes, liquidity signals, and narratives shaping Dogecoin price behavior in the cryptocurrency...

Crypto may face major volatility as the US job market weakens, pushing the Fed toward a pivotal December policy shift.

hypothesis_content.title: Regime-Specific Dogecoin Sentiment Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL or BEAR regime, positive Dogecoin-specific news or analysis (like the cited 'smarter analysis' article) generates a sharp, high-volume pump (>15% in 2 hours) that fades >50% of its gains within the next 6 hours, as momentum chasers are trapped without a supportive macro backdrop.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Meme coins like DOGE thrive on risk-on sentiment and broad market momentum. In neutral or bear regimes, isolated positive catalysts lack the sustained buying power to hold gains, leading to rapid profit-taking. High RSI and weak BTC are key filters.
entry_conditions: DOGE rallies >15% within 2 hours on identifiable news/analysis
BTC 1-hour price is below its 20-period EMA (confirming neutral/bear intraday bias)
DOGE 1-hour RSI(14) > 80 at peak of pump
Entry on first 30-minute candle close below the VWAP anchored to pump start

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 2-hour pump (from pump high to pre-pump open)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new high above the initial pump high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In neutral regimes, >40% of such DOGE pumps lead to continuation (gain >5% after entry signal) instead of a 50% fade, indicating stronger standalone momentum than hypothesized.
